p: Chromolaena odorata (L.) R. M. King and H.Rob. leaves aqueous extract was examined its atherogenic indices and plasma lipid profiles on rats that have fed loaded with cholesterol ( Ikewuchi and Ikewuchi, 2011). The intra-gastric gavages of the plant extract (100 mg/kg body weight) was administered to the rats. As a result, there was a significant reduction in total cholesterol, LDL, non-HDL, VLDL, and plasmaâ€™s triglyceride levels. The HDL-C level in the plasma was high once being treated with the extract. The extract contains saponin, which was reported to have a hypercholesterolemic activity ( Soetan, 2008). The extract significantly reduced (p < 0.05) the atherogenic index of plasma, cardiac risk ration, and atherogenic coefficient compared to the control group. Thus, the study showed that C. odorata could reduce the risk of heart diseases ( Ikewuchi and Ikewuchi, 2011).
